بسم اللّه الرّحمن الرّحيم
هذا ما اشترى أبو السّري بن هليه من إسحق بن أبنيله وهما جميعا من أهل الضّيعة المعروفة ببلجسوق ترس
اشترى منه سفقة واحدة وعقدة واحدة جميع حصته وإرثه من أبيه أبنيله بن إسحق بساحة هذه الناحية
في قبيلة الغسّال وهو الرّبع من جميع المنزل الّذي ورثه من أبيه أبنيله بن إسحق ستّة أسهم من أربعة
وعشرين سهما من هذا المنزل ويحيط به ويشتمل عليه حدود أربع حد حدود هذا المنزل الأوّل منه وهو القبلي ينتهي
إلي دار بني ينوق والحد الثّاني وهو البحري ينتهي إلي دار الغسّال ومنه يشرع بابه والحد الثّالث وهو الشّرقي ينتهي إلى منزل قنجوش بن شنوده
والحد الرّابع وهو الغربي ينتهي إلى منزل ثيدر بن إسحق جميع حصّنهحصته وإرثه بحدّه وحدوده ومدخله ومخرجه وعلوه وسفله وأرضه
وسمائه وطوبه وخشبه وحجارته وأبوابه وجميع ما يعرف له وينسب إليه شرى ثابت صحيح لا شرط فيه ولا وعد ولا رهن ولا وديعة ولا أتوى
على بيع الإسلام وعهدتهم بثمن مبلغه من العين المعزّي الوازن دينرين ونصف وربع عينا ذهبا جيادا وازنة بالجديد قبض إسحق بن أبنيله المسمّى
هذا الثّمن المذكور تامّا وافيًّا وأبرى أبو السّري بن هليه منه ومن عيونه ووزنه ونقده براه قبض واستيفا وسلّم إليه جميع هذه الحصّة المذكورة
فى من هذا المنزل المحدود الموصوف وحازها وملكها وصارت مالا من ماله وملك من ملكه يتحكّم فيه حكم الأرباب في أملاكهم إن شا باع
وإن شا وهب وإن شا صدّق وإن شا عمّر فمتى أدرك أبو السّري بن هليه في شرائه هذا أو في شي منه درك علقة أو خصومة طارئ بدين أو مستحق بميراث
من بعيد أو قريب حاضر أو غائب من سائر النّاس كلّهم فخلاص ذلك وإنقاذه ونفاذه وفكاكه على إسحق بن أبنيله من خالص ماله كائنا بما كان وبالغا ما بلغ وبذلك
أشهد على نفسه في صحّة عقله وبدنه وجواز أمره طائعا غير مكره ولا مجبر ولا مضطّهد طيّبة بذلك نفسه في شهر ربيع الأوّل سنة تسع وعشرين وأربع مائة
وهو من وحصپه من الدار الّمعول الدى سرڤى هدا المپرل داحل ڤى هدا السرا وكتپ پارپحه من حمبعها پمال منلعه من العپن المعرى الوارن پصف رپع دپپارا عپپا دهپا وارپه
قبض جميع ذلك وكتب سليمان بن إدريس بخطّه بعد ما وقّع وقع الشّهادة بحلّهما

In the name of God, the Compassionate, the Merciful.
This is what Abuʾs-Sarî b. Helia has bought from Isḥâq b. Abnîle, who both jointly are numbered among the people of the domain known as Bulǧusûq Teres:
he has bought from him in one striking (of hands) and one contract the whole of his share and his inheritance from his father Abnîle b. Isḥâq in the region of this village
in the tribe of al-Ġassâl, this being the quarter of the whole dwelling house that he has obtained by inheritance from his father Abnîle b. Isḥâq, six shares of twenty-
four shares of this dwelling house, and it is enclosed and surrounded by four boundaries. The first boundary of the boundaries of this dwelling house, viz. the southern, extends
to the house of the sons of Yanûq, and the second boundary, viz. the northern, extends to the house of al-Ġassâl, with which its door communicates, and the third boundary, viz. the eastern, extends to the dwelling house of Qanǧûš b. Šanûda,
and the fourth boundary, viz. the western, extends to the dwelling house of Theodor b. Isḥâq. (He has bought) the whole of his portion and his inheritance to its limit and its boundaries and its entrance and its exit, and (including) what is above and below the surface, and its land
and its sky, and its baked bricks and its timbers and its stones and its wooden doors, and all that is known as appertaining and relating to it, (in form of) a right, valid purchase, in which is no condition and no promise and no pledge and no deposit and nothing that can bring about a loss,
according to Islamic law of sale and to their (the Muslims) covenant, for a price, which in full weight gold-coins of al-Muʿizz amounts to 2 dînârs and a half and a quarter, gold-coins, good pieces, full weight, according to the new (standard). The aforesaid Isḥâq b. Abnîle has received
this (above) mentioned price fully and entirely, and he has given Abuʾs-Sarî b. Helia a quittance for it and for its gold-coins and its weight and ready money by means of a receipt (acknowledging that he has) received and taken (it) over fully, and he has handed over to him all this (above) mentioned share
of this dwelling house, defined and described, and he has acquired and taken possession of it and it has become his own property and possession, he having free disposition of it according to the free disposition of (the) proprietors over their property, (so that) if he will, he may sell it,
and if he will, he may give it away, and if he will, he may give it as an alms, and if he will, he may dwell in it. But if any evil consequence (vindicatio) with regard to this his purchase or any portion thereof should ensue to Abuʾs-Sarî b. Helia, on the basis of any contention or litigation, (be it) one who suddenly appears with a debt or one who makes a claim on the basis of any inheritance,
(be he) far or near, present or absent, of any persons whatever, then the indemnification, execution and redemption therefor are incumbent upon Isḥâq b. Abnîle out of his own means, whatever it might be or amount to, and he has called (be he) far or near, present or absent, of any persons whatever, then the indemnification, recuperation and redemption therefor are incumbent upon Isḥâq b. Abnîle out of his own means, whatever it might be or amount to, and he has called
evidence as to his responsibility, he being in a state of sound mind and body and capable of transacting his business, voluntarily, without compulsion and not against his will and not under constraint, of his own good <pleasure>, in the month of Rabîʿ I of the year four hundred and twenty nine.
And his share of the shelter which lies easterly of this dwelling house comes within this purchase, and he has written (on) its date ........................ entirely for (a sum of) money, which amounts in full weight gold-coins of al-Muʿizz to a half of a quarter of a dînâr, gold-coins, full weight, good pieces.
He has received this entirely, and Sulaimân b. Idrîs has written (it) in his (own) handwriting, after the testimony respecting their being quit of obligation having been given.
Nahâr b. Abiʾs-Sarî b. ʿUmar is witness
to all that (is contained) herein, and (it) has been written for him at his order and in his presence.
Sulaimân b. Idrîs b. Ǧaʿfar is witness to the acknowledgment by the seller and the buyer
respecting all that refers to them both, and he has written (it) in his (own) handwriting on its date. Valid.
Muḥammad b. Ǧaʿfar is witness to the acknowledgment by the above named persons
respecting all that (is contained) herein, and it has been written for him at his order and in his presence on its date. ʿAlî b. Ibrahîm is witness, and he has written (it) in his (own) handwriting.
